Entity.Description: The FactSchedule Fact table contains the lowest level of financial plan and actual data - at schedule line level - for the current and previous financial year.

Attribute.Description: The provider code supplied by SUS.
The foreign key to the keyOrgCodeOfProvider Surrogate key on the DimProvider table.
The commissioner code supplied by SUS.
The foreign key to the keyOrgCodeOfCommissioner Surrogate key on the DimCommissioner table.
The contract suffix added to the contract, which should correspond to the suffix assigned by CCAM rule processing.

The schedule code description, e.g. 'N EL Obstetrics'.

Foreign key to the keySubTotalID Surrogate key on the DimSubTotal table.
The HRG Code. -1 = Unknown.

For elective plan schedule lines only, indicates whether the plan is for all types of elective activity or just inpatient or daycase.
The code representing the specialised service within which the patient is treated. It is based on treatment specialties used by lead care professionals including consultants.
Foreign key to the keyActivityTreatmentFunctionCode Surrogate key on the DimTreatmentFunction table.
The code indicating whether a patient is making a first attendance or contact, or a follow-up attendance or contact.
Foreign key to the keyFirstAttendanceCode Surrogate key on the DimFirstAttendance table.
The code for the A&E department type.
Foreign key to the keyAandEDepartmentType Surrogate key on the DimAandEDepartmentType table.

Indicates whether the record (for DOA activity) is grouped to a 'Cost per A&E attend' SubTotal, which can be costed with the tariff for VB09Z (regardless of the HRG code output by the HRG grouper). If the patient was DOA, this is 70.
For inpatient elective activity, this is the code indicating the type of regular day attender activity (e.g. UNSET, Both RDA Activity and Non RDA Activity, Non RDA Activity only).
The best practice tariff code, if applied, otherwise it is NULL.
The specialist service code applied so that the schedule line is costed with the corresponding specialist service adjustment.
For 'Custom' SubTotals only, indicates whether the schedule line is an adjustment line and if it is a one-off payment or should be calculated on a pro-rata basis over the financial year.
Indicates whether Clarity uses validated SUS data or invoiced provider return data to allocate activity against the schedule line.
The total planned amount of activity for the financial year for the contract. This calculated field is obtained from the schedule table for years before 2013.
The planned activity for the year-to-date. This calculated field is obtained from the schedule table for years before 2013.
The amount of activity that has been invoiced by providers for the year-to-date. This calculated field is obtained from the schedule table for years before 2013.
The amount of activity that has been imported from SUS for the year-to-date. This calculated field is obtained from the schedule table for years before 2013.
The total planned expenditure for the financial year for the contract.
The planned expenditure for the year-to-date.

The year-to-date service line adjustment amount () for the financial year based on invoiced data from providers. Cost adjustment figures are not available from the schedule table prior to 2013. This figure is not reliable as it cannot be known whether invoiced provider data has already been cost-adjusted.
The year-to-date service line adjustment amount () for the financial year based on validated data from SUS. Cost adjustment figures are not available from the schedule table prior to 2013.
The expenditure that has been invoiced by providers for the year-to-date.
The year-to-date expenditure based on validated data imported from SUS.
The forecast amount of activity for the financial year based on validated activity data from SUS.
The forecast amount of activity for the financial year based on invoiced activity data from providers.
The forecast expenditure for the financial year based on invoiced cost data from SUS. This field is not available prior to 2013.
The forecast expenditure for the financial year based on validated cost data from SUS. This field is not available prior to 2013.
Notes entered for the schedule line.

The code of the SubTotalID type for the schedule line. This assigns the line to a particular section of the contract, e.g. Non-PbR Emergency Non Elective (112), which determines how it is costed by Clarity.
The emergency threshold baseline figure, expressed as a financial value. This is a calculated field to be obtained from schedule table by summing the values.
